content:
Excellent thinking! Packing basic bike maintenance tools can save you a lot of hassle and frustration if you encounter any mechanical issues during your trip. A pump and Allen wrenches are great additions to your toolkit, and here are a few more items you might consider bringing along:

1. **Tire pressure gauge**: This will help you ensure your tires are at the optimal pressure, which can improve your bike's performance and reduce the risk of flats.
2. **Chain breaker and spare chain links**: If your chain breaks, a chain breaker and spare links can help you get back on the road quickly.
3. **Quick-links or chain connectors**: These can be useful if you need to repair a broken chain or replace a worn-out link.
4. **Cable adjusters**: These can help you fine-tune your brake and gear cables if they become loose or misaligned.
5. **Multitool or pocket tool**: A compact multitool can provide a range of functions, such as scissors, pliers, and screwdrivers, which can come in handy for various repairs.
6. **Spare brake pads**: If you're riding in wet or rough conditions, your brake pads may wear out faster. Carrying spares can ensure you can stop safely.
7. **Chain lube and cloth**: Keeping your chain clean and lubricated can help prevent wear and tear, and reduce the risk of mechanical issues.

It's great that you've recently had a bike tune-up, which should help prevent many common issues. The new water bottle cage and bike lock are also excellent investments.

Remember to pack your tools in a convenient and accessible location, such as a saddle bag, handlebar bag, or frame-mounted tool carrier. This will save you time and effort if you need to make any adjustments on the go.

With your Garmin Edge 830 bike computer, Bontrager Flare R light, and these basic maintenance tools, you'll be well-prepared for a safe and enjoyable ride on the Blue Ridge Parkway.
